title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \
0  Afghanistan      Asia  1952           28.801             8.425333   
1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083   

   gdp_per_capita

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
This page examines how life expectancy changes with GDP per capita over time using the Gapminder dataset.
import pandas as pd import plotly.express as px
df = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”)
fig = px.scatter( df, x=“gdp_per_capita”, y=“life_expectancy”, animation_frame=“year”, animation_group=“country”, color=“continent”, hover_name=“country”, size=“population_millions”, log_x=True, labels={ “gdp_per_capita”: “GDP per Capita (log scale)”, “life_expectancy”: “Life Expectancy”, “population_millions”: “Population (millions)” }, title=“Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita Over Time” ) fig.show()

title: Country Analysis
text:
This page tracks changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population over time for a single country (United States).
import pandas as pd import plotly.express as px
df = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”)
country_name = “United States” c = df[df[“country”] == country_name].sort_values(“year”)
fig = px.line( c, x=“year”, y=[“life_expectancy”, “gdp_per_capita”, “population_millions”], markers=True, labels={ “value”: “Value”, “variable”: “Metric”, “year”: “Year” }, title=f”{country_name}: Life Expectancy, GDP per Capita, and Population Over Time” ) fig.show()

title: Gapminder Website
text: This website uses the Gapminder dataset (1952–2007) to explore how life expectancy relates to GDP per capita and population across countries and over time.

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
This page analyzes the relationship between life expectancy and population size across countries.
import pandas as pd import plotly.express as px
df = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”)
fig = px.scatter( df, x=“population_millions”, y=“life_expectancy”, color=“continent”, hover_name=“country”, animation_frame=“year”, animation_group=“country”, size=“gdp_per_capita”, labels={ “population_millions”: “Population (millions)”, “life_expectancy”: “Life Expectancy”, “gdp_per_capita”: “GDP per Capita” }, title=“Life Expectancy vs Population Over Time” ) fig.show()
